categories.title: Information and data technologies
categories.description: Knowledge and application of tools, techniques, and systems for managing, analysing, visualising, and interpreting data

skills.title: Data/database management systems

skills.title: Data architecture/data structure format & design

skills.title: Data acquisition

skills.title: Data cleaning

skills.title: Data protection & ethics

skills.title: Data management

skills.title: Metadata standards

skills.title: Spreadsheets

skills.title: Statistics and probability

skills.title: Data mining

Superset of data cleaning - broader process that includes cleaning but also involves reshaping, enriching, transforming, and merging data from multiple sources to make it suitable for analysis.

skills.title: Big data technologies

skills.title: AI/ML concepts and theory
skills.description: Ability to understand and apply fundamental concepts underlying AI/ML systems and applications

skills.title: AI/ML techniques and models

skills.title: Machine learning technologies
skills.description: Ability to design, build, test, and deploy machine learning models and systems as software applications

skills.title: General Web technologies & APIs

skills.title: Web accessibility
skills.description: Ability to design and build websites and web applications that are usable by everyone, including individuals with disabilities

skills.title: Web frameworks for front-end development

skills.title: Web frameworks for back-end development
skills.description: Proficiency in server-side programming languages, understanding of database systems, and knowledge of API development

skills.title: Mobile app development
skills.description: Ability to create, test, and deploy mobile applications via use of programming languages, UI/UX design, backend development and testing

skills.title: Compilers

skills.title: Writing code & knowledge of programming languages
skills.description: Skills in writing programming languages involve understanding syntax, algorithms, data structures

skills.title: Generative AI
skills.description: Ability to leverage AI tools to augment and enhance traditional software development processes

skills.title: Reading and understanding code/documentation
skills.description: Comprehending technical documents to grasp software functionality, architecture, and usage

skills.title: Data analysis & visualisation
skills.description: Ability to process, analyse, and interpret data, as well as the ability to communicate findings effectively through visual representations

skills.title: Regular expressions
skills.description: Ability to use and understand regular expressions (regex), which are sequences of characters that define a search pattern in a text

skills.title: Computer modelling & simulation
skills.description: Ability to contruct and manipulate computer-based mathematical, graphical or algorithmic representations of real life systems or phenomena, for the purpose of conducting computer-based simulations to study, predict or optimise the behaviour of the system(s) / phenomena under consideration.

skills.title: Coding conventions, code formatting and linting tools
skills.description: Understanding and applying coding standards, using tools to automatically format code, and employing linters

skills.title: Testing methodologies & tools

skills.title: Debugging tools
skills.description: Ability to use various techniques and tools to identify, isolate, and fix errors in software code.

skills.title: Code review techniques (including pair programming)
skills.description: Ability to effectively evaluate and improve the quality of code by understanding the code structure, logic as well as soft skills like clear communication and constructive feedback

skills.title: Profiling & optimising code
skills.description: Ability to analyse code execution, identify performance bottlenecks, and implement changes to improve efficiency and responsiveness

skills.title: Log analysis

skills.title: Software version control
skills.description: Ability to effectively use tools and techniques to track, manage, and collaborate on changes to source code, ensuring efficient development and collaboration

skills.title: Software quality practices & assurance

skills.title: Documenting code & software
skills.description: Ability to create clear, concise, and comprehensive technical documentation that communicates the design, functionality, and usage of software products

skills.title: Organising and documenting software projects

skills.title: Software licensing
skills.description: Technical expertise in license management systems, understanding different license models, and the ability to implement and enforce license agreements

skills.title: Deploying code
skills.description: Expertise in taking packaged software and making it available in a target environment (e.g., staging, production) - including provisioning infrastructure, configuring services, rolling out updates, handling rollbacks, and ensuring minimal downtime.

skills.title: Containerisation
skills.description: Ability to package, deploy, and manage applications using containers, enabling consistent and reliable execution across diverse environment

skills.title: Task automation/tool pipelines
skills.description: Expertise in creation and maintenance of automated workflows that build, test, and deploy software

skills.title: Computational scientific workflows
skills.description: Ability to design, run and manage the sequence of tasks - computational data pipelines (scientific workflows) - within a WMS (workflow management system) using workflow definition languages

skills.title: Environmental impact awareness & measurement
skills.description: Ability to understand the environmental consequences of software development and deployment, including energy consumption, resource usage, and the overall carbon footprint of the software lifecycle

skills.title: Programming paradigms
skills.description: Ability to understand and apply different approaches to structuring and organising code

skills.title: Threads, processes & parallelisation

skills.title: Requirements gathering
skills.description: Ability to effectively elicit, analyse, and document the needs and requirements of stakeholders, translating them into a clear and actionable set of specifications

skills.title: Software patterns
skills.description: Ability to identify, understand, and apply well-established, reusable solutions to common problems in software development

skills.title: Designing APIs
skills.description: Ability define and create Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that effectively facilitate communication between different software systems

skills.title: Software architecture
skills.description: Ability to define, design, and implement the foundational structure of a software system

skills.title: Designing user interfaces
skills.description: Proficiency in design principles, tools, and an understanding of user behaviour

skills.title: Designing user experience

skills.title: Accessibility (for disabled people)

skills.title: Supercomputer architecture

skills.title: Cluster infrastructure

skills.title: Cluster management

skills.title: Performance profiling and optimisation
skills.description: Performance modelling and tuning, identifying bottlenecks using profiling tools, scalability analysis

skills.title: Benchmarking code
skills.description: Identifying appropriate test cases, formatting/presenting the data

skills.title: Cost modelling

skills.title: Usage of HPC systems

skills.title: Web protocols

skills.title: Serverless Web applications

skills.title: Firewalls

skills.title: Cloud computing
